summary: The Uplifting First-Time Homebuyers Act of 2025, introduced in the House of Representatives, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The primary focus of the bill is to increase the limitation on qualified first-time homebuyer distributions from $10,000 to $50,000. This change is intended to make it easier for individuals to purchase their first homes. The amendment's effective date is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2024.
